intro: Odontites vernus subsp. pumilus, commonly known as the alpine toothbrush, is a small, herbaceous plant native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe. It typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often at high altitudes. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in a loose cluster, which bloom in early summer. This subspecies is characterized by its compact growth form and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
